AIDS: AIDS is a life-threatening disease that affects millions of people globally. Curing AIDS would not only save lives but also end the stigma and discrimination faced by those affected by the disease.

Alzheimer's: Alzheimer's is a progressive and irreversible neurological disorder that affects memory and cognitive function. Curing Alzheimer's would not only improve the quality of life for those affected but also reduce the burden on caregivers.
Heart Disease: Heart disease is the leading cause of death worldwide. Curing heart disease would significantly reduce the number of deaths and improve overall public health.

Diabetes: Diabetes affects millions of people worldwide and can lead to various complications. Curing diabetes would not only improve the quality of life for those affected but also reduce healthcare costs.

Malaria: Malaria is a mosquito-borne disease that affects millions of people in developing countries. Curing malaria would not only save lives but also improve overall public health in affected regions.
